medical: PROCEDURE: Upper endoscopy with foreign body removal. PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS (ES): Esophageal foreign body. POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS (ES): Penny in proximal esophagus. ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS: None. COMPLICATIONS: None. DESCRIPTION OF PROCEDURE: After informed consent was obtained, the patient was taken to the pediatric endoscopy suite. After appropriate sedation by the anesthesia staff and intubation, an upper endoscope was inserted into the mouth, over the tongue, into the esophagus, at which time the foreign body was encountered. It was grasped with a coin removal forcep and removed with an endoscope. At that time, the endoscope was reinserted, advanced to the level of the stomach and stomach was evaluated and was normal. The esophagus was normal with the exception of some mild erythema, where the coin had been sitting. There were no erosions. The stomach was decompressed of air and fluid. The scope was removed without difficulty. SUMMARY: The patient underwent endoscopic removal of esophageal foreign body. PLAN: To discharge home, follow up as needed.
layman:
**Procedure:** Upper endoscopy to remove a foreign object.  

**Pre‑procedure diagnosis:** Something stuck in the esophagus.  
**Post‑procedure diagnosis:** A penny was found in the upper part of the esophagus.  

**Estimated blood loss:** None.  
**Complications:** None.  

**What happened:**  
After the patient gave permission, she was taken to the pediatric endoscopy room. The anesthesia team sedated her and put a breathing tube in. A small camera (endoscope) was passed through her mouth, over her tongue, and into her esophagus. The penny was found, grabbed with special forceps, and taken out. The endoscope was then used again to look at her stomach, which looked normal. The esophagus looked normal except for a little redness where the penny had been. No tears or other damage were seen. The stomach was cleared of air and fluid. The endoscope was removed easily.  

**Summary:** The penny was removed with an endoscope.  

**Plan:** The patient can go home and will see a doctor if needed.
